references.paper_title: StyTr2: Image style transfer with transformers
references.reason: This paper is highly relevant due to its introduction of a novel transformer-based approach to image style transfer, a key technique discussed and evaluated in the current work.

references.paper_title: DiffStyler: Controllable dual diffusion for text-driven image stylization
references.reason: This paper is cited for its introduction of a dual diffusion model for text-driven stylization, offering advancements in stylization techniques used for evaluation in this research.

references.paper_title: Artist: Aesthetically controllable text-driven stylization without training
references.reason: This paper is highly relevant as it presents a new training-free approach to text-driven image stylization which is directly compared against in the current work.
This foundational paper introduces denoising diffusion implicit models, a core technology used in many of the image generation and stylization methods referenced and evaluated in this study.

references.paper_title: LAION-5B: An open large-scale dataset for training next generation image-text models
references.reason: This paper is crucial due to its introduction of the LAION-5B dataset, a significant resource used as a benchmark in the aesthetic evaluation methods described within the paper.
